attributes.action: Use the Consumer Price Index (CPI) to calculate interest charged on Student Loans.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently the Student Loans Company uses the Retail Price Index to calculate the interest charged on student loans. This stands at 4.8%.

The Bank of England uses the Consumer Price Index to measure inflation. Currently 3.1%.

There is nothing stopping the RPI rising above the Bank of England base rate. So student debt could eventually become more expensive than other forms of debt.

The SLC should use the Consumer Price Index. Thus keeping student debt as "cheap" debt, as was originally intended.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/CPI-not-RPI/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
